hits.name: Rivet
hits.long_description:
Rivet is a visual tool that sits above a codebase. It's a bridge that lets product designers own any UI change to the software they work on. 

Designers use Rivet today to shortcut painful design handoffs and just make any visual change themselves. This saves time for designers and engineers and makes it radically easier to build software with great design and taste. 

This becomes the next design tool because it lets designers break out of static tools and prototype like frontend engineers.  Use real components from your existing codebase to design remarkably complex interactions, and then ship it yourself.
hits.one_liner: Rivet helps product designers change software without coding.

hits.name: Clicks
hits.long_description:
Clicks automates your back-office using your existing tools and processes without requiring any IT integrations.

What We Do:
Think of Clicks as your back-office worker that can handle any repetitive task. Simply describe your process via video call or share documentation, and our forward-deployed engineering team ensures it's automated exactly your way.
Our AI agents work 24/7 and can be kicked-off via email, Slack, or our web app, handling tasks like CRM updates, report generation, and data entry while adapting to your existing software.

Initial Focus:
We're starting with recruiting and executive search firms, automating candidate codification, assessment reports, and administrative workflows that typically consume hours of manual work each day.

Value Proposition:
Our pricing is 100% outcome based: you only pay for the work outputs we complete (e.g., candidates added to CRM, reports generate, etc.). Current customers are already live and saving an average of 60% in costs compared to human workers, with full automation deployed within one week.
hits.one_liner: The first AI back-office worker that works like a human.

hits.name: Sourcebot
hits.long_description:
Sourcebot is an open source code understanding platform for massive codebases. Weâ€™re used by thousands of engineers in some of the largest companies in the world, including NVIDIA, Red Hat, Wikimedia, and Arista Networks.

Understanding code, not writing it, is the primary bottleneck for large engineering teams. For developers, this means onboarding onto complex codebases faster. For AI agents, it means getting the necessary code context to minimize hallucinations and maximize cohesion within the wider codebase.

Sourcebot solves this by giving developers and AI agents the ability to regex search across millions of lines of code instantly, as well as ask questions across thousands of repos using any flagship reasoning model. Being open source and on-prem, we can get deployed in enterprises within minutes before other tools even get approval.

We (Brendan and Michael) met a decade ago at McGill University, and have been building together full time for over 2 years. Weâ€™ve personally felt the pain of understanding large codebases while working at Microsoft, EA, Ubisoft, Google, and Meta.

hits.name: Imagine AI
hits.long_description:
Imagine AI is a task-based agentic AI that becomes your company's Head of Content. For B2B service firms, this means turning your partners' expertise into a pipeline-generating machine. Instead of executives spending 8+ hours a week trying to write posts, our AI performs deep research to build a 100-page persona, captures their authentic voice, and automates content that books meetings at named accounts.

Our college-dropout, second-time founding team includes Sky Yang (raised $150M as UCSD's youngest Student Body President) and Neo Lee (a Berkeley Math/AI researcher). The idea for Imagine AI came after a YC partner told us directly: founders and partners at B2B firms are experts at their jobs, but they consistently struggle to turn that expertise into effective marketing that drives revenue.

We launched just 8 weeks ago and have already reached $14k in revenue from 30 paying users, including forward-thinking firms like Conduit (YC '24). The demand is clear, with a 250+ person waitlist. The results are even clearer: one of our first users recently landed a $5M deal that originated from a single post our AI created.

We are displacing the expensive, low-ROI agency model by building the content OS for every LinkedIn-native B2B company. 

To see how we automate your pipeline, book a demo at https://calendar.notion.so/meet/skyyang333/ghost 

or connect with our CEO, Sky Yang, on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/skyyang/

hits.name: s2.dev
hits.long_description:
S2 is a serverless datastore for real-time, streaming data.

The more we worked on data systems, the more we felt like there was a missing building block. The seamless experience of object storage simply did not exist for durable streams â€“ so we set out to fix that!

S2 reimagines streams as an unlimited and access-controlled web resource. Like if Kafka and S3 had a baby.

- Building agents? Use granular streams to persist context in real time, make workflows auditable, and coordinate between agents.

- Publishing fast-moving data? Streams support high fanout and can be accessed directly over the internet, so they are a great fit for broadcasting real-time feeds.

- Sandboxing? Emit to per-instance streams, and read history or live events just as easily.

- Local-first and multiplayer experiences? Propagate updates reliably and efficiently.

Stop dealing with clusters, and start streaming.
hits.one_liner: Streams as a cloud storage primitive

hits.name: Compyle
hits.long_description:
Compyle is a less autonomous coding agent that asks before it acts. We're like Cursor or Claude Code - but you won't need to rewrite your codebase every time you use it for more than a small task.

We built Compyle because we were frustrated with the direction other coding agents are headed. They're all racing to be more autonomous, running for hours without human input.

This doesn't work for real production code. When agents run autonomously, they make countless small decisions that pile up in your codebase. Engineers lose ownership - they don't know what was implemented, can't effectively debug or maintain it, and struggle to build on top of it. The code becomes a black box, and they're forced to throw it away.

Compyle keeps engineers in the driver's seat.
hits.one_liner: Lovable for Software Engineers

hits.name: Multifactor
hits.long_description:
The agentic era is here, but its foundation is dangerously insecure. A growing number of high-profile "AI agent gone rogue" security incidents make headlines each week.

As enterprise adoption of agentic software has far outpaced the development of applicable cybersecurity solutions, CISOs have loudly voiced a growing need for verifiable, fine-grained security controls on complex multi-agent systems. That's why we built Multifactor.

Multifactor offers best-in-class authentication, authorization, and auditing technologies for agentic systems, allowing users to securely and revocably share online accounts with agents while maintaining fine-grained permissions and a detailed event history. We are doing for AI security what Cloudflare did for web security, Okta did for identity security, and Wiz did for cloud security: defining the category.

A world-class "account manager" that allows agents to securely use online accounts on your behalf is just the startâ€”our early enterprise partners include companies using AI agents to manage $7.5+ billion manufacturing supply chains, where the consequences for lapses in security are severe. Our patented AI security technology seamlessly integrates with existing agentic software to thwart attacks like prompt injection, so CISOs and end users alike can breathe a sigh of relief, without slowing the pace of AI adoption.
hits.one_liner: Zero-trust authentication, authorization, and auditing for AI agents

hits.name: SF Tensor
hits.long_description:
AI researchers should be pushing the boundaries of what's possible with new architectures and training methods. Instead, they waste weeks configuring cloud infrastructure, debugging distributed systems, and optimizing their GPU code. We know because we lived it: While training our own models across thousands of GPUs earlier this year, we spent more time fighting our infrastructure than doing actual research.

That why we're building two things. First, Elastic Cloud: a managed platform that automatically finds the cheapest GPUs across all providers, handles spot instance preemption, and cuts compute costs by up to 80%. Second, automatic kernel optimization that makes training code run faster by modeling hardware topology, often beating hand-tuned implementations.

The problem is that getting high performance across different hardware is genuinely hard. NVIDIA's CUDA moat exists because writing fast kernels requires deep expertise. Most teams either accept vendor lock-in or hire expensive kernel engineers. Our goal is to break the CUDA moat.

The compute bottleneck is the biggest constraint on AI progress. NVIDIA can't manufacture enough GPUs, and their monopoly keeps prices astronomical. Meanwhile, AMD, Google, and Amazon are shipping capable alternative hardware that nobody uses because the software is too hard. We're breaking that moat. If we succeed, anyone will be able to train state-of-the-art models without thinking past their PyTorch code.
hits.one_liner: Infrastructure for AI labs to focus on research.

hits.name: Tell if AI
hits.long_description:
Tell If AI is a team founded by ex DeepMind and Yandex researchers focused on fighting  deepfakes and AI generated slop. We've trained our own state of the art foundation model on a massive amount of data sampled from over 70 different generative AI models. For content found in the wild, we offer 99% precision and recall at detecting whether that content was made or modified with AI and we can indicate precisely which AI model made the content. We work with image, video, and audio.

Try our free demo at https://tellif.ai.
hits.one_liner: Detect deepfakes and AI generated images, videos, and audio.

Companies waste billions on bad ads, mismatched landing pages, and poor budget allocation. Uplane fixes this by replacing a patchwork of agencies, spreadsheets, and siloed tools with one self-improving system. Digital marketing is a $740B market with a 10% CAGR. Our model compounds: we charge a base fee plus 10% of ad spend, outperforming marketing agencies that typically charge 10-30%.

Our team has deep founder-market fit: Julius managed a 7-digit monthly ad budget at one of the biggest ad spenders in Europe; Marvin has an academic background in Data Science (Imperial, Harvard) and led growth analytics & operations at a unicorn; Lukas was Head of Engineering at two YC startups, Blair (S19) and Fastgen (W23).
